meanings.sent1: She always whitters when things don't go her way.
meanings.sent2: Please don't whitters about the weather, just enjoy the day.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat started to whitters when it couldn't find its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: His constant whitters were like a broken record, repeating the same complaints.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her whitters echoed through the house, filling it with negativity.

meanings.definition: A person who whines or complains
meanings.sent1: Don't be a whitters, try to see the positive side of things.
meanings.sent2: The office is full of whitters who always find something to complain about.
meanings.sent3: The little whitters in the park made everyone smile with their cute complaints.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the queen of whitters, always finding something to grumble about.
meanings.sent5: The group of whitters gathered together, forming a choir of complaints.

meanings.definition: The act of whining or complaining
meanings.sent1: His constant whitters were starting to annoy everyone around him.
meanings.sent2: The whitters in the meeting made it hard to focus on the agenda.
meanings.sent3: The whitters in the movie theater were louder than the film itself.
meanings.sent4: The whitters of the wind outside matched her mood perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the unpleasant sound of whitters, creating a negative atmosphere.
